summary: This is a legal memorandum filed by the Government of the United States Virgin Islands (USVI) seeking to intervene in the civil case Giuffre v. Maxwell. The USVI requests confidential access to sealed summary judgment documents and unfiled discovery materials to aid its separate civil enforcement action under the Virgin Islands Criminally Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act (CICO) against the Estate of Jeffrey Epstein and related entities. This is a legal motion filed by the Government of the United States Virgin Islands (USVI) seeking to intervene in a civil case and modify a protective order. The USVI argues it needs confidential access to unfiled discovery deposition documents and exhibits from the civil action to aid its own law enforcement action against Jeffrey Epstein's sex-trafficking conduct, especially since Epstein's death makes his direct testimony unavailable.

persons.name: Virginia L. Giuffre
persons.context: Plaintiff in the civil defamation lawsuit against Ghislaine Maxwell. The USVI motion references her opposition to Maxwell's summary judgment motion.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Defendant in the civil defamation lawsuit filed by Virginia Giuffre. The USVI motion references her motion for summary judgment.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier whose estate and controlled entities are the subject of the USVI's CICO enforcement action. The document alleges he operated a criminal sex-trafficking enterprise in the Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Identified as an executor of the Epstein Estate and Secretary for the Epstein-controlled entity Great St. Jim, LLC, which allegedly facilitated the trafficking enterprise.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.context: Identified as an executor of the Epstein Estate and Treasurer for the Epstein-controlled entity Nautilus, Inc., which allegedly facilitated the trafficking enterprise.

persons.name: William H. Narwold
persons.context: Attorney from Motley Rice LLC who filed and signed this motion on behalf of the Government of the United States Virgin Islands, serving as counsel of record.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the central figure whose sex-trafficking conduct is at issue in both the civil action and the USVI's law enforcement action. The motion notes his death in federal prison makes his direct testimony unavailable.

connections.description: Implied association through the civil lawsuit and the USVI's allegations of a criminal enterprise. Maxwell is a defendant in the related Giuffre case.
Indyke served as an executor of Epstein's estate and as Secretary for Epstein's company Great St. Jim, LLC.
Kahn served as an executor of Epstein's estate and as Treasurer for Epstein's company Nautilus, Inc.
Both are co-executors of the Epstein Estate and held officer positions in Epstein-controlled companies.
Plaintiff and defendant in the underlying civil defamation lawsuit (Giuffre v. Maxwell).

connections.person2: Government of the United States Virgin Islands
connections.description: Narwold is the counsel of record filing this motion on behalf of the USVI government.

connections.person1: Government of the United States Virgin Islands
connections.description: The USVI is pursuing a law enforcement action (CICO action) against Epstein's estate or associates regarding his sex-trafficking conduct in the Virgin Islands.

events.title: USVI Files Amended CICO Complaint
events.description: The Government of the United States Virgin Islands filed its First Amended Complaint in its CICO enforcement action against the Epstein Estate and related entities.

events.title: Transport of Victims to Little St. James
events.description: Flight logs show girls and young women were transported to the Virgin Islands and helicoptered to Epstein's private island, Little St. James, during this period.

events.title: Escape Attempt and Passport Confiscation
events.description: Two victims, one aged 15, attempted to escape from Little St. James. Epstein organized search parties, located them, returned them to his house, and confiscated the 15-year-old's passport.

events.title: USVI Files Motion to Intervene
events.description: The Government of the United States Virgin Islands filed this memorandum in support of its motion to intervene in Giuffre v. Maxwell to obtain access to sealed documents.

events.title: Epstein's Death in Federal Prison
events.description: The motion references Epstein's death in federal custody, which occurred after discovery was taken in the civil action, rendering his direct testimony unavailable for the USVI's case.

events.title: Filing of USVI Motion to Intervene and for Access
events.description: The Government of the United States Virgin Islands files this ex parte motion to intervene in the civil case and to modify the protective order to gain access to unfiled discovery deposition documents and exhibits.
personsInvolved: Government of the United States Virgin Islands

locations: Superior Court of the U.S. Virgin Islands
United States District Court Southern District of New York
Hartford, CT (Motley Rice LLC office address)
keyFacts: The USVI alleges Jeffrey Epstein operated a criminal sex-trafficking enterprise in the Virgin Islands, using his private islands and a network of companies to transport, isolate, and abuse underage girls.
Flight logs from 2001-2019 show girls and young women were transported to the Virgin Islands and to Epstein's private island, Little St. James; some victims appeared as young as 11.

Epstein's companies Plan D, LLC, Great St. Jim, LLC, and Nautilus, Inc. are accused of facilitating the trafficking scheme, with estate executors Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn serving as officers for the latter two.
The USVI seeks confidential access to sealed summary judgment documents and unfiled discovery from Giuffre v. Maxwell for use in its separate CICO civil enforcement action against the Epstein Estate.
The document references an incident where Epstein confiscated a 15-year-old victim's passport after she and another victim attempted to escape from Little St. James.
The USVI is pursuing a civil RICO (CICO) law enforcement action related to Jeffrey Epstein's sex-trafficking conduct.
Epstein's death in federal prison is cited as a key reason the USVI needs access to deposition testimony from the related civil case, as his direct testimony is now unavailable.
The motion argues for modifying a blanket protective order, stating parties have lesser reliance interests in such orders compared to targeted ones.
The USVI seeks to avoid duplicative discovery and promote judicial efficiency by accessing already-produced discovery from the civil action.
The filing attorney is William H. Narwold of Motley Rice LLC, representing the Government of the United States Virgin Islands.
